name: 3D Matrix Result Organization
description: How to organize and present boot time results using the 3D matrix structure
purpose: Teach AI clients to group metric_points by target × mode × os_id dimensions for team-standard report format
query_examples: Show me boot time results for the past week
critical_principle: ALWAYS organize boot time results by the 3D matrix (target × mode × os_id) unless user explicitly requests different grouping

step_1.receives: Array of metric_points with dimensions fields

step_3.action: Group metric_points by unique (target, mode, os_id) combinations
step_3.method: Create nested structure or tables organized by these three dimensions

step_4.action: Present results showing comparisons across dimensions

example_presentation.description: Organize by target (rows) × mode (columns) × os_id (table separation)

alternative_presentation.description: When tables are impractical, use hierarchical grouping

key_insights_enabled.platform_comparison: Which hardware platform has fastest boot? (qemu: 7050ms vs raspberry-pi: 8200ms)
key_insights_enabled.mode_comparison: Which image type boots faster? (package: 7050ms vs container: 7150ms)
key_insights_enabled.os_comparison: Which OS variant boots faster? (autosd: 6900ms vs rhel: 7050ms)

undefined_dimensions.description: Some metric_points may have 'undefined' for target, mode, or os_id
undefined_dimensions.reason: Data source (Horreum) had missing or null label values
undefined_dimensions.presentation: Group 'undefined' separately or note as 'Unknown' in reports

sparse_matrix.description: Not all combinations of (target × mode × os_id) will have data
sparse_matrix.presentation: Use 'N/A' or blank cells for missing combinations in tables

critical_rules: ALWAYS group results by target × mode × os_id when presenting boot time data
DO NOT present flat lists of numbers without dimension grouping
DO include comparison insights (fastest platform, mode, OS)
DO handle 'undefined' dimensions gracefully (note as missing data)
DO show trends over time within each (target, mode, os_id) group
see_also: domain://examples/statistical-analysis - Add statistics to matrix presentation
